abstracts.cdata!:
The Agricultural Research and Extension
            Project for Peru aims at contributing to the expansion,
            strengthening, and institutional development of the rural
            agricultural technology and innovation system so it is
            pluralistic, decentralized, demand driven, and led by the
            private sector. The project has the following four
            components: Component 1) will advance the development of a
            decentralized market for professional services for
            agricultural innovation. It will strengthen producer
            organizations as beneficiaries of quality services, and
            improve entrepreneurial capacity of private service
            providers. Component 2) will strengthen agricultural
            research and technological development for innovation in
            strategic areas of national importance, and to strengthen
            institutional and professional competence. Component 3) will
            develop the institutional capacity of the public sector to
            formulate and implement agricultural innovation policy in
            conjunction with the private sector, and regulate the
            quality of the National Agricultural Innovation System
            (NAIS). Component 4) will finance the present Research and
            Extension Project for Innovation and Competitiveness in
            Peruvian Agriculture (INCAGRO)-Project Management Unit
            (PMU), which would continue to be the implementing agency
            for Phase II.
